intro: Stylidium repens var. sacculatum, commonly known as the sacculate sun-orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive, spurred petals and a unique structure that facilitates pollination by specific insect species. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. This variant is part of the orchid family and is known for its specialized adaptations to its harsh environment.
